channel.title: Day 1 schedule on Complexity Methods for Behavioural Science
channel.description: Recent content in Day 1 schedule on Complexity Methods for Behavioural Science

item.title: Introduction to the Course
item.description: About the course Course site: https://complexity-methods.github.io We refer to websites that have assignments and additional literature, one we call “the course book” … https://darwin.pwo.ru.nl/skunkworks/courseware/1819_CMBS/book/ Additional literature (the PDFs will be available on Brightspace) Most assignments about analyses were designed for R. You do not need to learn to script/code, you mainly need to be able to load data and run scripts. There will be instructions in lecture notes and assignment solutions that should give you enough information to work out what to do.

item.title: Introduction to Complexity Science
item.description: Slides [Download slide]() Literature Chapter II of Thelen & Ulrich (1991) provides a great overview of many of the topics discussed during the lecture. Thelen, E., & Ulrich, B. D. (1991). Hidden skills: A dynamic systems analysis of treadmill stepping during the first year. Monographs of the Society for Research in Child Devevelopment, 56(1), 1-98; discussion 99-104. Retrieved from https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1922136 Digging deeper See the recommended books on complexity

item.title: Assignments Mathemathics of Change
item.description: Slides EXTRA: Slides on coupled systems EXTRA: Slides on fitting parameters Assignments Growth models and deterministic chaos EXTRA: Coupled systems EXTRA: Fitting parameters to analytic solutions of growth models

item.title: Introduction to the Mathematics of Change
item.description: Slides Download slides as PDF View slides as HTML Literature Chapter 3 of the course book explains some of the basics of difference and differential equations and how to simulate them. More detailed information and (formal) explanations about nonlinear phenomena can be found in: Kaplan, D., & Glass, L. (2012). Understanding nonlinear dynamics. Springer Science & Business Media. (see Brightspace) Digging deeper This series on Differential Equations is excellent, but also expecting some background knowledge.
